Package ohos.data.rdb

Interface RdbStore


  • public interface RdbStore
    Provides methods for managing the relational database (RDB).

    This class provides methods for creating, querying, updating, and deleting RDBs.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Data#DATA_APPDATAMGR

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  RdbStore.ConflictResolution
      Indicates the type of the method for resolving conflict.

      • insert

        long insert​(String table,
            ValuesBucket initialValues)
        Inserts a row of data into the target table.
        Parameters:
        table - Indicates the target table.
        initialValues - Indicates the row of data to be inserted into the table. The data comprises key-value pairs stored in ValuesBucket. The key-value pairs are associated with column names of the table.
        Returns:
        Returns the row ID if the operation is successful; returns -1 otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • insertOrThrowException

        long insertOrThrowException​(String table,
                            ValuesBucket initialValues)
        Inserts a row of data into the target table.
        Parameters:
        table - Indicates the target table.
        initialValues - Indicates the row of data to be inserted into the table. The data comprises key-value pairs stored in ValuesBucket. The key-value pairs are associated with column names of the table.
        Returns:
        Returns the row ID if the operation is successful; returns -1 otherwise.
        Throws:
        RdbException - Throws this exception if an SQLite database error occurs. You must handle this exception by yourself.
        Since:
        1

      • batchInsertOrThrowException

        List<Long> batchInsertOrThrowException​(String tableName,
                                       List<ValuesBucket> initialValues,
                                       RdbStore.ConflictResolution conflictResolution)
        Inserts data into the database in batches based on the conflict handling policy.

        If the conflict handling policy is null, the default policy ConflictResolution#ON_CONFLICT_NONE will be used. If an exception occurs during the data insertion, the operation varies depending on the type of the conflict handling policy.

        • ConflictResolution#ON_CONFLICT_ROLLBACK: If a data conflict occurs, the database column is null, or the database column has only one value, all the inserted data will be rolled back.
        • ConflictResolution#ON_CONFLICT_ABORT or ConflictResolution#ON_CONFLICT_FAIL: If a data conflict occurs, the database column is null, or the database column has only one value, the inserted data will be retained, and an exception will be thrown.
        • ConflictResolution#ON_CONFLICT_IGNORE: If a data conflict occurs or the database column is null, the exception will be ignored, and value -1 will be returned. The data insertion will continue until all data is inserted into the database. If the foreign key does not exist or a foreign key conflict occurs, see ConflictResolution#ON_CONFLICT_ABORT.
        • ConflictResolution#ON_CONFLICT_REPLACE: If a data conflict occurs, or the database column has a default value or only one value, the conflict data will be replaced and the data insertion will continue until all data is inserted into the database. If the database column has no default value or a foreign key conflict occurs, see ConflictResolution#ON_CONFLICT_ABORT.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Indicates the table name of the database.
        initialValues - Indicates the data to be inserted into the database.
        conflictResolution - Indicates the conflict handling policy.
        Returns:
        Returns the IDs of all the rows if the batch insertion is successful. If the ConflictResolution#ON_CONFLICT_IGNORE policy is used, the returned list may contain -1.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the table name is null or an empty string, initialValues is null or an empty list, a value in initialValues is null or an empty string, or the number of values in initialValues exceeds RdbStore#MAX_BATCH_INSERT_SIZE.
        RdbException - Throws this exception if the data fails to be inserted into the database.
        Since:
        3

      • replace

        long replace​(String table,
             ValuesBucket initialValues)
        Replaces a row of data in the target table.

        If the target row does not exist, this method inserts a row.

        Parameters:
        table - Indicates the target table.
        initialValues - Indicates the row of data used to replace the row of data in the target table. The data comprises key-value pairs stored in ValuesBucket. The key-value pairs are associated with column names of the table.
        Returns:
        Returns the row ID if the operation is successful; returns -1 otherwise.
        Since:
        1

        Parameters:
        table - Indicates the target table.
        initialValues - Indicates the row of data used to replace the row of data in the target table. The data comprises key-value pairs stored in ValuesBucket. The key-value pairs are associated with column names of the table.
        Returns:
        Returns the row ID if the operation is successful; returns -1 otherwise.
        Throws:
        RdbException - Throws this exception if an SQLite database error occurs. You must handle this exception by yourself.

      • insertWithConflictResolution

        long insertWithConflictResolution​(String table,
                                  ValuesBucket initialValues,
                                  RdbStore.ConflictResolution conflictResolution)
        Inserts a row of data into the target table and specifies the method for resolving conflict.

        initialValues - Indicates the row of data to be inserted into the table. The data comprises key-value pairs stored in ValuesBucket. The key-value pairs are associated with column names of the table.

        Returns:
        Returns the row ID if the operation is successful; returns -1 otherwise.
        Since:

      • delete

        int delete​(AbsRdbPredicates absRdbPredicates)
        Deletes data from the database based on a specified instance object of AbsRdbPredicates.

        You can pass an instance object of AbsRdbPredicates such as RdbPredicates and RawRdbPredicates to specify the delete condition. If you pass the RdbPredicates object, you can call methods such as RdbPredicates#equalTo to set the deletion condition. If you pass the RawRdbPredicates object, you can only set the database tableName, whereClause and whereArgs. whereArgs is the value of a placeholder in the whereClause and must be the same as the sequence of the placeholder.

        Parameters:
        absRdbPredicates - Indicates the specified delete condition by the instance object of AbsRdbPredicates.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of affected rows.
        Since:
        4

      • update

        int update​(ValuesBucket values,
           AbsRdbPredicates absRdbPredicates)
        Updates data in the database based on a a specified instance object of AbsRdbPredicates.

        You can pass an instance object of AbsRdbPredicates such as RdbPredicates and RawRdbPredicates to specify the update condition. If you pass the RdbPredicates object, you can call methods such as RdbPredicates#equalTo to set the update condition. If you pass the RawRdbPredicates object, you can only set the database tableName, whereClause and whereArgs. whereArgs is the value of a placeholder in the whereClause and must be the same as the sequence of the placeholder.

        Parameters:
        values - Indicates the row of data to be updated in the database. The data comprises key-value pairs stored in ValuesBucket. The key-value pairs are associated with column names of the database table.
        absRdbPredicates - Indicates the specified update condition by the instance object of AbsRdbPredicates.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of affected rows.
        Since:
        4

        Parameters:

        absRdbPredicates - Indicates the specified update condition by the instance object of RdbPredicates.
        conflictResolution - Indicates the method for resolving conflict.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of affected rows.

      • executeSql

        void executeSql​(String sql)
        Executes an SQL statement that returns no value.

        Do not use this method to change the journal_mode of a database connection by the "PRAGMA journal_mode'value'" statement.

        Parameters:
        sql - Indicates the SQL statement to execute.
        Throws:
        RdbException - Throws this exception if the SQL statement is invalid. You must handle this exception by yourself.
        Since:
        1

      • executeSql

        void executeSql​(String sql,
                Object[] sqlArgs)
        Executes an SQL statement that contains specified parameters but returns no value.

        Do not use this method to change the journal_mode of a database connection by the "PRAGMA journal_mode'value'" statement.

        Parameters:
        sql - Indicates the SQL statement to execute.
        sqlArgs - Indicates the values of the parameters in the SQL statement. The values are strings.
        Throws:
        RdbException - Throws this exception if the SQL statement is invalid. You must handle this exception by yourself.
        Since:
        1

      • buildStatement

        Statement buildStatement​(String sql)
        Compiles an SQL statement into a reusable statement.

        A Statement cannot be used by two threads at the same time.

        Parameters:
        sql - Indicates the SQL statement to compile.
        Returns:
        Returns a Statement object, which indicates a precompiled SQL statement.
        Since:
        1

      • count

        long count​(String tableName,
           String whereClause,
           String[] whereArgs)
        Queries the number of rows that meet specified conditions in the RDB store.

        To obtain an executable SQL inquiry statement, concatenate the table name and condition clause into the string select count(*) from tableName where whereClause, and replace question marks (?) in the string with the values in whereArgs. In this way, you can then call Statement#executeAndGetLong to execute the SQL inquiry statement to obtain the number of rows that meet the specified conditions. If whereClause is null or empty, the total number of rows in the table is returned.

        Parameters:
        tableName - Indicates the name of the database table. If it is null or empty, IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        whereClause - Indicates an optional condition clause, such as id =? and name like ?, in which id and name are columns of the database table.
        whereArgs - Indicates the array that contains the values used to replace question marks (?) in whereClause.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of rows that meet specified conditions in the RDB store.
        Since:
        1

      • count

        long count​(AbsRdbPredicates absRdbPredicates)
        Obtains the number of rows in which data meets the specified instance object of AbsRdbPredicates.
        Parameters:
        absRdbPredicates - Indicates the specified count condition by th instance object of AbsRdbPredicates.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of rows in which data meets the specified instance object of AbsRdbPredicates.

      • listAttached

        List<Pair<String,String>> listAttached​()
        Queries the list of attached databases.
        Returns:
        Returns the list of attached databases, including their names and paths. The primary database is also included in the list.
        Since:
        3

      • changeEncryptKey

        void changeEncryptKey​(byte[] newEncryptKey)
        Changes the encryption key of an encrypted database that is opened.

        This method applies only to an encrypted database and cannot be used to change it to an unencrypted one. Before calling this method, ensure that the database is opened and that no transaction is using the database connection. For the maximum size of the encryption key, see StoreConfig#MAX_ENCRYPT_KEY_SIZE.

        Parameters:
        newEncryptKey - Indicates the new encryption key of the database.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the new encryption key is null or an empty string.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the database is not opened or not encrypted, or a transaction is using the database connection.
        RdbException - Throws this exception if changing the encryption key of the encrypted database fails.
        Since:
        3

      • getVersion

        int getVersion​()
        Obtains the database version.
        Returns:
        Returns the database version.
        Since:
        1

        Parameters:
        version - Indicates the database version to set.
        Since:

      • beginTransaction

        void beginTransaction​()
        Begins a transaction in EXCLUSIVE mode.

        The endTransaction() method is used to end the transaction. If the markAsCommit() method is not used to mark the transaction as commit when the transaction ends, all the changes will be rolled back.

        Since:
        1

      • beginTransactionWithObserver

        void beginTransactionWithObserver​(TransactionObserver transactionObserver)
        Begins a transaction in EXCLUSIVE mode with a listener.

        The endTransaction() method is used to end the transaction. If the markAsCommit() method is not used to mark the transaction as commit when the transaction ends, all the changes will be rolled back.

        Parameters:
        transactionObserver - Provides callback methods that can be called when transactions are started, committed, or rolled back.
        Since:
        1

      • markAsCommit

        void markAsCommit​()
        Marks the current transaction as commit.

        After calling this method, do not perform any operation before calling the endTransaction() method. The transaction will be committed regardless of whether an error occurs.

        Since:
        1

      • endTransaction

        void endTransaction​()
        Ends a transaction.
        Since:
        1

      • isInTransaction

        boolean isInTransaction​()
        Checks whether the current thread is engaged in a transaction.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the current thread is engaged in a transaction; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • giveConnectionTemporarily

        void giveConnectionTemporarily​(long milliseconds)
        Disconnects from the database temporarily to allow other threads to use the database.

        This method can be used to commit the current transaction and disconnect from the database temporarily so that other threads can use the database. After a specified period, a new transaction will be started. When using this method, ensure that the current transaction is started and that the transaction is not marked as committed using the markAsCommit() method; otherwise, calling this method will fail. Any change that has been made before this method is called cannot be rolled back.

        Parameters:
        milliseconds - Indicates the duration (ms) during which the current connection is interrupted from the database.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the current thread contains no transaction or contains nested transactions, or if the transaction has been marked as committed using the markAsCommit() method before this method is called.
        Since:
        3

      • isHoldingConnection

        boolean isHoldingConnection​()
        Checks whether this thread holds a database connection.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this thread holds a database connection; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • checkIntegrity

        boolean checkIntegrity​()
        Checks integrity of the primary and attached databases.

        This method calls the integrity_check command of the SQLite database.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the databases are integral; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • close

        void close​()
        Closes an RDB.

        A closed RDB can no longer be used.

        Since:
        1

      • backup

        boolean backup​(String destName)
        Backs up a database in a specified name.

        The generated backup file is unencrypted.

        Parameters:
        destName - Indicates the name that saves the database backup. Ensure that your application has write permissions to this name.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the database is backed up successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • restore

        boolean restore​(String srcName)
        Restores a database from a specified unencrypted database file.

        When being called, this method deletes the original data and generates an unencrypted database.

        Parameters:
        srcName - Indicates the name that saves the unencrypted database file. Ensure that your application has write permissions to this name.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the database is restored successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • backup

        boolean backup​(String destName,
               byte[] destEncryptKey)
        Backs up a database in a specified name using a specified encryption key.

        The generated backup is encrypted. If destEncryptKey is null, the generated backup is unencrypted. In that case, this method is equivalent to the RdbStore#backup(String) method. For the maximum size of the encryption key, see StoreConfig#MAX_ENCRYPT_KEY_SIZE.

        Parameters:
        destName - Indicates the name that saves the database backup. Ensure that your application has write permissions to this name.
        destEncryptKey - Indicates the encryption key of the database to back up. It can be different from that of the current database.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the database is backed up successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • restore

        boolean restore​(String srcName,
                byte[] srcEncryptKey,
                byte[] destEncryptKey)
        Restores a database from a specified encrypted or unencrypted database file.

        When being called, this method deletes the original data and generates an encrypted or unencrypted database, as defined by your application. If both srcEncryptKey and destEncryptKey are null, this method is equivalent to the RdbStore#restore(String) method. For the maximum size of the encryption key, see StoreConfig#MAX_ENCRYPT_KEY_SIZE.

        Parameters:
        srcName - Indicates the name that stores the source database file. Ensure that your application has write permissions to this name.
        srcEncryptKey - Indicates the encryption key of the source database. If the database is unencrypted, set the value of this parameter to null.
        destEncryptKey - Indicates the encryption key of the restored database.If you want the database to be unencrypted, set the value of this parameter to null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the database is restored successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • configLocale

        void configLocale​(Locale locale)
        Sets the database locale.

        This method is unavailable if the database is read-only or the data set is in a transaction. After the database locale is set, you can use select * from table where column=xxxx COLLATE LOCALES; or select * from test order by column COLLATE LOCALES ASC; to sort and query data locally.

        Parameters:
        locale - Indicates the locale to set.
        Since:
        4

      • toString

        String toString​()
        Obtains the description of the database store.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        Returns the description of the RdbStore.
        Since:
        1
